title: Web developer LMIA requested
description: Education: Bachelor's degree. or equivalent experience. Tasks: Consult with clients to develop and document Website requirements. Design and integrate website related code. Write, modify, integrate and test software code. Communicate technical problems, processes and solutions. Assist in the collection and documentation of user's requirements. Conduct tests and perform security and quality controls. Write, modify, integrate and test software code for e-commerce and other Internet applications. Computer and technology knowledge: Development and operations (DevOps). Model-View-Controller (MVC). Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF). HTML. Internet. Desktop applications. JavaScript. CSS. SQL. .NET. ASP.NET. C#. MS Office. MS Windows. API. Angular.js. Bootstrap. GitHub. MS Visual Studio Code (VS Code). Postman. TypeScript. MS Excel. Equipment and machinery experience: Scanner. Area of work experience: Information technology (IT) service delivery. Area of specialization: Development of computer applications. Development. Screening questions: Are you authorized to work in Canada?. Experience: 7 months to less than 1 year. Other benefits: Free parking available. Other benefits. Team building opportunities.

title: Sr. React.js Developer with PHP exp (70% React.js/30% PHP)
description: Title: Sr. React.js Developer with PHP exp (70% React.js/30% PHP) Location : Toronto, ON- Hybrid(3 days a week) Duration: 6+ months Job Description: • 10 + years of experience building and optimizing complicated user interfaces and extensive experience working within large-scale development environments. • Strong hands-on experience building/working large and complex client-facing web applications using ReactJS, HTML CSS, CMS/UI experience. • Developing and implementing highly responsive user interface components using react concepts. • Monitoring and improving front-end performance, documenting application changes, and developing updates. • Deep experience building beautiful, intuitive, and accessible customer facing applications. • Experience with frontend patterns, testing, debugging and performance. • Experience in PHP is preferred. • Ability to multi-task and prioritize in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment. • Solid communication and written skills: ability to explain complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences.. • Strong problem-solving mindset

title: INTERMEDIATE WEB DEVELOPER
description: You, the ideal candidate, are outgoing and will show initiative, contributing intellectually to the improvement or streamlining of internal practices and procedures wherever you perceive an opportunity. You like to avoid quick-fix "band-aid" solutions, and small one-off development tasks, preferring instead to spend a little more time creating solid, carefully thought out leverageable solutions that will be re-used over and over again, building consistency and avoiding unnecessary development time over the long run. You have a strong affinity for HTML and CSS compliance, and accessibility on the web. You have education and experience coding ASP.Net and/or PHP, in conjunction with MS-SQL Database server. Must Have Skills • Very Good understanding of C# or PHP • Strong relational database knowledge and SQL • Hand coding in JavaScript, JQuery, JSON, Ajax, CSS, and HTML • Strong knowledge of at least one front-end framework like Angular, Backbone, React, Vu • Experience with API integration using SOAP/RESTful/JSON • Excellent knowledge of design patterns • Excellent understanding of OO programming and S.O.L.I.D. principles • Excellent problem solving / troubleshooting skills Areas of Responsibility • Analyze requirements and code modules • Build responsive web sites • Write unit tests General Qualifications/Assets • Preferred University degree or college diploma in Design, Communications, Computer Science or other related field • 2 years of experience in web development involving complex jQuery and SQL programming • Self-starter who is comfortable in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment • Highly motivated and detail oriented • Able to perform well under tight deadlines • You are able to commit to working standard business hours (0830 to 1700), but are flexible when needed. Please send your cover letter and resume to careers@axis-dbm.com. No attachments other than Microsoft Word or Acrobat PDF will be accepted. You may also copy and paste your resume and cover letter into the email body.

title: On-Site Web Developer : Build & Optimize Websites
description: A tech services company in Mississauga is seeking an Entry-level Website Developer to consult with clients and develop website requirements. The role involves designing code, optimizing content, and providing ongoing client support. Candidates should have a minimum of 1 year of experience in website development and possess strong technical communication skills. This is a full-time position located on-site with no remote option. #J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Full-Stack Web Developer
description: Hi there! Thanks for stopping by Are you actively looking for a new opportunity? Or just checking the market? Well… you might just be in the right place! We are looking for a Full-Stack Web Developer to join our Marketing team and help build, maintain, and evolve our marketing website and related applications. You will work across the stack — from creating intuitive, user-friendly front-end components to building and maintaining robust back-end systems. For this role, you should be located in Canada, and able to work within EST/EDT hours. We offer a choice of fully remote, partially remote or fully office-based work environments (in cities with local offices). What you will be doing • Develop and maintain scalable, maintainable, and secure full-stack applications and web components • Build, evolve, and implement new and existing UI/UX features in close collaboration with the design team • Develop and optimize backend logic, APIs, and integrations to support frontend functionality • Maintain and extend our WordPress ecosystem, including custom themes, plugins, and Gutenberg blocks • Ensure high standards of code quality through reviews, testing, and peer collaboration • Participate in technical discussions, architecture decisions, and feature planning • Stay current with both frontend and backend best practices and technologies What you need to bring: • Strong experience with backend development (PHP and Node.js, databases such as MySQL/Postgres) • Proficiency in JavaScript (ES6+), with experience in frameworks such as React • Strong knowledge of semantic HTML, CSS (Sass/LESS), and building responsive, accessible interfaces • Knowledge of SEO best practices in development to ensure code and content structure support overall search visibility • Experience working with RESTful APIs and integrations (building and consuming) Solid experience with CMS platforms (e.g., WordPress, Wordpress Multisite & Gutenberg) and customizing them when needed • Experience with version control (Git/GitHub) and modern development workflows • Solid understanding of cross-browser/platform compatibility issues and solutions • Ability to estimate, scope, and deliver features independently and as part of a team • Ability to contribute to clear documentation and actively share knowledge to support team collaboration and project continuity • A strong interest in great UX and performance-driven development • As a global company with employees and clients outside of Quebec, fluency in English as a working language is required for this position. Nice to have • Experience with testing (unit, integration, e2e with Cypress/Jest) • Knowledge of Google Tag Manager (GTM) and website analytics (GA4) • Familiarity with TypeScript • Experience with cloud hosting environments (e.g., AWS, GCP) and deployment workflows • Knowledge of security and performance best practices for web applications • Experience working in an Agile development environment • Leverage AI-assisted development tools thoughtfully to improve productivity, while ensuring code quality, security, and maintainability Now, what is in it for you? • Ability to do your job in a truly flexible environment; • Genuine career opportunities in a company that's creating new jobs everyday; • Work in a team big enough for growth but lean enough to make a real impact. …. And enjoy a range of benefits that will keep you happy, healthy and (not) hungry. • Lightspeed equity scheme (we are all owners). • Flexible paid time off and remote work policies. • Health insurance. • Contributions to your pension plan - RRSP. • Health and wellness benefit of $500 per year. • Paid leave and assistance for new parents. • Mental health online platform and conseling & coaching services. • Training opportunities to grow your skills and career. • Volunteer day. #LI-SS3 To all recruitment agencies: Lightspeed does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. If we have not directly engaged your company in writing to supply candidates for a specific vacancy, Lightspeed will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Lightspeed is a proud equal opportunity employer and we are committed to creating an inclusive and barrier-free workplace. Lightspeed welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Where to from here? Obviously, this has to be mutually beneficial: we want you to step into a role you love, and we want to offer you a place you're proud to come to every day. For a glimpse into our world check out our career page here. Lightspeed is building communities through commerce, and we need people from all backgrounds and lived experiences to do that. We were founded in 2005, in Montreal's gay village and our original members were all part of the LGBTQ+ community. The ethos of our business has been about inclusion from the very beginning, and we strive to provide a workplace where everyone belongs. Who we are: Powering the businesses that are the backbone of the global economy, Lightspeed's one-stop commerce platform helps merchants innovate to simplify, scale, and provide exceptional customer experiences. Our cloud commerce solution transforms and unifies online and physical operations, multichannel sales, expansion to new locations, global payments, financial solutions, and connection to supplier networks. Founded in Montréal, Canada in 2005, Lightspeed is dual-listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: LSPD) and Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: LSPD). With teams across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company serves retail, hospitality, and golf businesses in over 100 countries. Lightspeed handles your information in accordance with our Applicant Privacy Statement.

title: Web Developer; Independent Contractors
description: Position: Web Developer (Independent Contractors) Who We Are Wood Green is a team of diverse and innovative change makers working together to make a difference in our communities. A United Way Anchor Agency with a proven track record and an entrepreneurial mindset, we continuously seek to develop solutions to critical social needs while striving to become a Centre for Equity. Visit (Use the "Apply for this Job" box below). to learn more about who we are and to review our . We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce, representative of the communities we serve. We encourage, and are pleased to consider, applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized persons/persons of colour, women/women identifying, persons with disabilities, 2 SLGBTQIA+ persons, and others who contribute towards promoting innovative ideas and solutions. Program Overview - Independent Contractors We are seeking skilled web developers to support the ongoing maintenance, updates, and optimization of our organizational website. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, responsive, and experienced in working within established design systems and CMS platforms. Wood Green engages third-party vendors to support staff on projects on an as needed basis and eager to gather a list of pre-screened vendors to be added to our vendor list. Responsibilities: • Maintain and update content, pages, and features on Wood Green’s website (built on Word Press). • Troubleshoot technical issues and ensure website performance, accessibility, and security. • Implement design and functionality updates in collaboration with the Communications and IT teams. • Optimize pages for user experience, SEO, and mobile responsiveness. • Support the integration of digital tools, analytics, and plugins as needed. Qualifications: • Proven experience managing and developing Word Press websites (or similar CMS platforms). • Strong understanding of front-end development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP basics). • Familiarity with Google Analytics 4, SEO best practices, and accessibility standards (WCAG). • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. • Experience with nonprofit or public-sector websites is an asset. Portfolio required: Please include examples of websites you have developed or maintained, noting your specific contributions. Wood Green is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free selection process and work environment. If contacted in relation to an employment opportunity, please advise our People & Culture representatives at of the accommodation measures required. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. This public job posting uses AI-powered tools to screen, assess, or select applicants.

title: Web developer/Designer
description: No. of position: 1Key responsibilities:- Design and develop website layouts, contributing creative input to a variety of digital projects.- Oversee the management and daily updates of all company websites to ensure content remains current and relevant.- Perform regular maintenance and enhancements to existing sites, addressing any technical issues as they arise.- Utilize scripting and authoring languages, management systems, content development tools, and digital media applications to support website functionality and user experience.- Edit, write, and design website content; coordinate and guide team members responsible for producing digital materials.- Assess user needs by conducting technical requirement analyses to inform website features and improvements.- Leverage social media platforms such as Facebook, Twitter, and WordPress to share information, foster engagement, and promote the organization’s website and initiatives. -FinalRequirements for Web Developer Position- Bachelor’s degree (or current enrolment) in Web Development, Computer Science, or a related discipline, or equivalent professional experience.- Demonstrated web design expertise with a compelling portfolio showcasing completed projects.- Advanced proficiency in WordPress site management and content updates.- Strong ability to communicate, collaborate, and present creative concepts to enhance website design and functionality.- Proficient in using web development software, scripting languages, and digital content management tools.- Exceptional written and verbal communication abilities.- Capable of working independently with minimal supervision.- Collaborative team player committed to shared goals and project success.- Resilient and able to excel in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.- Solid understanding of programming languages and technical terminology relevant to web development.- Skilled at developing innovative ideas and processes, and expressing them clearly to stakeholders.- Proven problem-solving ability for complex technical challenges.Location:Toronto, ON, Canada (Hybrid)Weekly working hours: Flexible.We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.(Apply below)
via: Startup Job Board - University Of Toronto

title: INTERMEDIATE WEB DEVELOPER
description: Intermediate Developer (JAVA/Angular Minimum 4 plus years experience The Enterprise Applications and Solutions Integration department within the Chief Information Officer '' s (CIO) Division is a central department responsible for all matters pertaining to the development, maintenance and effectiveness of the core administrative management and student systems. Included within these responsibilities are all central SAP systems, such as Financial Services, Human Resources, Research Administration and Procurement; the central U of T Student System; approximately 40 related vendor and specialized web applications, as well as central Business Intelligence and Document Management applications. Your opportunity: Under the general supervision of the Student Information Systems {SIS) Development Manager, you will be part of a dynamic, collaborative and an innovative development team, responsible for producing quality code as it pertains to application development. You will also be expected to contribute to, and participate regularly in the Software Development Life Cycle methodology that the team uses, for implementation of enterprise wide solutions, to its divisional clients across the university (Tri-Campus). Your responsibilities will include: - Analyzing, recommending, and designing highly complex software architecture - Developing and updating architectural framework for highly complex and confidential university-wide applications - Writing complex technical code - Evaluating programming code to ensure it has validity, compatibility, and that it meets appropriate standards - Commenting on programming code for the purposes of standardization and consistency - Analyzing, recommending and designing technical solutions for highly complex IT problems Qualifications - Essential Qualifications: - Bachelor''s degree in computer science or an acceptable equivalent combination of education and experience. - Minimum four plus years relevant experience in applications development: JAVA and Angular experience is required. - Demonstrated ability to lead technical teams in highly complex projects. - Proficiency building J2EE web applications: Java EE Web Services, Java Servlets, JSP, Struts, Spring MVC, JSTL, Junit, JavaScript, Angular , JPNHibernate, HTMLS. - Extensive knowledge of CSS and JS methods for providing Performant Visual Effects and AODA. - Thorough understanding of the responsibilities of the platform, database, AP[, caching layer, proxies, and other web services used in systems. - Demonstrated ability to work within tight timelines; ability to problem-solve technical issues, exercise good judgment, ability to work effectively independently as part of a team. - Excellent client service skills, ability to communicate effectively and accurately both orally and in writing, including the ability to communicate technical concepts to persons with limited technical backgrounds. To be successful in this role you will be: - Adaptable - Goal oriented - Motivated self-learner - Possess a positive attitude Job 70426

title: Web Development Specialist
description: eliterecruitshub Overview: As a Web Developer, you will be responsible for designing, coding, and modifying websites, from layout to function and according to a client's specifications. You will strive to create visually appealing sites that feature user-friendly design and clear navigation. Your role will involve collaborating with various stakeholders including clients, designers, and other developers to ensure successful project completion. Responsibilities: Designing and implementing website layouts based on client specifications and user experience principles. Developing server-side and client-side code for web-based applications. Integrating graphics, audio, and video components into the website for enhanced user experience. Writing clean, efficient, and well-documented code using best software development practices. Collaborating with graphic designers to ensure visually appealing site design. Testing website functionality, identifying technical problems, and debugging issues. Conducting ongoing website maintenance, including monitoring performance, optimizing loading speeds, and updating content. Staying abreast of new trends and technologies in web development and recommending relevant updates and improvements. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including designers and marketers, to ensure the successful execution of digital projects. Providing technical support and troubleshooting for website-related issues. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Web Development, or a related field (or equivalent work experience). Proven experience as a web developer, with a strong portfolio showcasing previous work. Proficiency in front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and jQuery. Experience with responsive design techniques and frameworks (e.g., Bootstrap). Familiarity with server-side languages such as PHP, Python, or Ruby on Rails. Experience with database systems (e.g., MySQL, MongoDB) and proficiency in SQL. Solid understanding of web development best practices, including SEO principles. Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git). Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Excellent communication and teamwork abilities. Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Knowledge of web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics) is a plus. Preferred Qualifications: Experience with content management systems (e.g., WordPress, Drupal). Knowledge of UX/UI design principles. Familiarity with graphic design tools such as Adobe Photoshop or Illustrator. Understanding of accessibility standards and best practices. This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the Web Developer position and is not an exhaustive list of skills, efforts, duties, responsibilities, or working conditions associated with it. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice. Sector: Employment and Placement Agencies/Recruiting Role: Administration / Payroll Will manage other people: Yes Job type: Permanent job Career level: Employee

title: Junior Web Developer - Cheil Canada
description: Cheil Canada Who are we? Cheil Canada is a full-service agency based out of Mississauga, Ontario and part of the Cheil Worldwide network, offering a variety of marketing & advertising solutions. We are a full-service data-driven company, rooted firmly in customer experience and performance. We work across the entire customer journey, creating connections that result in relevant and meaningful personalization through: • Data & Insight • Retail Marketing & Shopper Marketing • Digital and Social Marketing • eCommerce & eRetailer Marketing Job Summary We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Junior Web Publisher to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for publishing, updating, and maintaining content across our web platforms. The ideal candidate has a strong understanding of web publishing processes and front-end technologies, and experience working with content management systems (CMS). This is an excellent opportunity for someone with 1–3 years of experience looking to further develop their skills in a collaborative environment. Key Responsibilities: Publish, update, and maintain content across web platforms using a CMS. Collaborate with designers, developers, and other teams to ensure content is displayed accurately and optimized for user experience. Troubleshoot and resolve content-related issues on the website. Ensure website consistency in terms of layout, style, and branding. Test and validate content updates for various browsers and devices. Adhere to SEO best practices when publishing content. Assist in monitoring website performance and work on performance improvements. Stay up to date with web publishing trends and emerging technologies. Required Skills & Qualifications: 1–3 years of experience in web publishing, web content management, or a similar role. Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Experience with content management systems (e.g., WordPress, Drupal, Joomla, or any proprietary CMS). Strong attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines. Basic understanding of SEO and web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics). Good communication skills and a team player. Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies. Preferred Qualifications: Familiarity with front-end frameworks like Bootstrap or similar. Experience working with version control systems (e.g., Git). Basic design skills or experience with graphic editing tools (e.g., Photoshop, Figma, etc.). Cheil Canada truly believes in diversity and hires talent with a wide range of knowledge, skills and professional background. As part of Cheil Worldwide, Cheil Canada plays its part in one of the world’s biggest agency networks–comprising of 54 offices and nine affiliates in 46 countries globally. Cheil is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. All qualified candidates will receive equal consideration without regard to race, creed, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, age, marital status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. We believe that diversity and inclusion is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.

title: Full Stack Developer (Hybrid)
description: Job Title- Full Stack Developer Location- Toronto, Canada, Hybrid Front-end Development (ReactJS): (50% Heavy experience) • Building modern and responsive user interfaces with ReactJS, including component-based architecture and state management. • Utilizing JavaScript, HTML, and CSS for front-end development. • Integrating with back-end APIs using tools like Axios or Fetch API. • Ensuring cross-browser compatibility and optimizing for performance Back-end Development (Java): (50% Experience) • Designing and developing robust, scalable, and secure RESTful APIs and microservices using Java frameworks like Spring Boot. • Working with databases (SQL and NoSQL) and ORM tools (e.g., Hibernate, Spring Data JPA) for data persistence. • Implementing authentication and authorization mechanisms (e.g., Spring Security, JWT). • Understanding and applying software design patterns and best practices. Job Type: Fixed term contract Contract length: 12 months Pay: From $50.00 per hour Application question(s): • What is your visa status Work Location: Hybrid remote in Toronto, ON M5J 1E3

title: Senior Software Developer Full Stack
description: Do you have 3+ years experience Azure APIM, Azure Service Bus, Azure Containers Apps/Jobs, Azure DevOps? Do you have ﻿8+ years experience in ASP.NET Core / Minimal API’s / LINQ (.NET 8+)? If so, this would be a great opportunity for you! Our client is looking for a Senior Software Developer Full Stack for a 6 contract in Toronto. This is an onsite role. Advantages • Earn a competitive rate within the industry. • Location : 5 days onsite. Responsibilities • Provides subject matter expertise and identifies and encourages areas for improvement. • Delivers the best user experiences possible and is jointly accountable for the quality of the products and services that they deliver for the customers. • Provides mentoring to specific Software Development I and potentially Software Engineer I to discuss specific engineering practices and problems that may arise during day-to-day work. Provides context and perspective to the project Software Development and Software Engineers regarding engineering design decisions as well as business requirements that influence implementation details. • Coaches and mentors project team members by elevating their scope of knowledge and breadth in aspects of design and development best practices. • Shares new trends and techniques with project team members via various forums, like chapters. • Develops supporting and configuration documentation, or guides project team members in delivering technical documentation. • Provides input and expertise to QA team on application testing. • Provides work estimates for their own development tasks and verifies work estimates of others. • Performs code reviews and walkthroughs of system design and developed code. • Participates in and contributes to requirement definition working sessions, specification development and solution design. • Develops applications to specifications within the required timeframe and budget. • Identifies risks and escalates to project/product leadership on a timely basis. • Pinpoints strengths and weaknesses of various design alternatives and selects or recommends appropriate solutions. • Proactively suggests alternative methods or resources for getting work done when obstacles arise. • Reviews systems for completion and system performance objectives. • Recommends changes across the project team's engineering practices as well as external team practices to improve the team's cycle time as well as lead time for the team's product backlog. • Leads the change in the adoption of new engineering practices across the project team. • Independently engages and actively participates in project team discussion with product management teams to recommend product features and changes to product features to improve the user experience, operation and maintainability of the product. • Participates in development of engineering plans and systems specifications with Lead Engineers. • Collaborates with project team members to ensure alignment of practices, patterns, and solutions. • Ensures work aligns to broader roadmaps and systems strategies. • Stays abreast of evolving technology, architecture, and design, patterns, practices, and platforms. • Makes decisions and proposes solutions where results have substantial impact across the organization requiring sophisticated solutions and long-term correction. Occasionally has cross-portfolio and external stakeholder interactions. Qualifications Must Haves: • 8+ years experience React 18/ HTML 5 / CSS. • ﻿8+ years experience ASP.NET Core / Minimal API’s / LINQ (.NET 8+). • 3+ years experience Azure APIM, Azure Service Bus, Azure Containers Apps/Jobs, Azure DevOps. • 3+ years experience SQL Server / REDIS Cache. Nice to Have: • Microservices/Docker. Summary If you are interested in the Senior Software Developer Full Stack role in Toronto, please apply online at www.randstad.ca. Qualified candidates will be contacted. Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community. Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Senior Fullstack Developer (Typescript/NodeJS)
description: Our client is seeking a Senior Developer on a contract basis to work on their modernization program. The ideal candidate has expertise in Typescript/Node.js Location: Hybrid Markham 4d/week Duration: 6 months Responsibilities • Design, develop, and maintain fullstack applications using TypeScript, Node.js, and React. • Build scalable REST APIs, backend services, and integrations aligned with enterprise standards. • Participate in sprint planning, backlog refinement, architecture discussions, and technical design sessions. • Write clean, testable, well-structured code with unit, integration, and end-to-end test coverage. • Conduct code reviews, provide constructive feedback, and help raise the overall code quality. • Work closely with product managers, UX designers, and cross-functional teams to deliver customer-focused features. • Troubleshoot production issues, optimize application performance, and improve reliability. • Contribute to CI/CD pipelines, automation, and DevOps best practices. • Participate in code reviews and help elevate engineering standards within the team. • Document technical designs, workflows, and implementation details. Requirements: • 5+ years of hands-on software development experience building fullstack applications. • Strong proficiency in TypeScript and Node.js for backend development (Express, NestJS, or similar). • Experience with React, Next.js, or another modern front-end framework. • Experience designing and consuming REST APIs, and working with microservice or modular architectures. • Strong understanding of SQL and/or NoSQL databases and data modeling (PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, etc.). • Practical experience with Azure or AWS (Azure preferred), including deployments, monitoring, and cloud-based services. • Proficiency with Docker, containerized development, and modern CI/CD pipelines (Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, etc.). • Familiarity with automated testing frameworks (Jest, Mocha, Playwright, Cypress). • Strong understanding of secure coding practices, authentication, and authorization (JWT, OAuth2, SSO). • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to break down complex requirements.
